intro: Maytenus diversicymosa, commonly known as the variable mayten, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed, and it is often found in moist, tropical forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its morphological variability and potential medicinal properties.
